name: places/ChIJg6RN-ohZwokR46kzRvoI9zU
formattedAddress: 389 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 389 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Creative cocktails & DJ music in a gold-themed space with a velvet rope out front.

originalText.text:
My roommate, former USC Basketball Superstar turned Finance and Real Estate Mogul, bought us a table here to celebrate him closing on his brand new G-6. He already has a G-5, but I guess he really wanted a G-6 lol.

We arrived at about 1am after a dinner at Lure, and were greeted like royalty when we hopped out of the fleet of escalades. The doormen and bouncers were extremely nice to us, I don't know what these other reviews are talking about hahahaha.

After he was done kissing babies, dapping up everyone in sight, and saying "AWWWW when they gonna give you a night off big bro!?! You be working too hard!" to the bouncers, we were shuttered to a table in the back that would become our post up spot for the night. I'm really shy and have trouble holding a conversation because of my severe social anxiety, so I was just kind of on the wall the whole night observing, haha :)

I NEED to shout out the bottle girl taking care of us, Kaylee. She is actually the main reason for me writing this review, talk about white glove service! We as a society need to give the Kaylee's of the world their flowers. Anything we needed, she was there for us. Our drinks were never empty, always coming in to check on us, and just a pleasant human being to be around. She even eased my social anxiety a bit!

It's even become a thing in our friend group. When you are out at a restaurant, spa, bar... or anywhere really, great service is known as "Kaylee Service."

She asked my roommate if he wanted to bring out the sparklers with the first round of Magnum Grey Goose bottles and champagne, but he is so lowkey and such a good guy that he didn't want to call all that attention to himself. How can you not respect that?

Thank you Goldbar! I will never forget this night.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

originalText.text:
the experience depends on how well-equipped you are.
go: if you did your research on ny nightlife scene & know the DJ/bouncer/bartender/owner (or willing to spend a lot of money) and you’ll have a great time
don’t go: if you have no idea, visiting town and just stumbled upon here based on social media recs, or not dressed accordingly

originalText.text:
SCAM! AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
On a Sunday night we decided to go to the bar. The bouncers received us nicely and asked for a card + ID for the bar tap. We gave it. After an hour, I received a notification on my phone that they tried to charge 300$ without any consent (thankfully my bank blocked the transaction). We had 1 drink each. After this, we went to ask for the check:
They came back after 5 minutes with the ID and card and gave us a 200$ bill. They stated that the minimum charge was 200$. Once we told them we were not aware, we were presented an envelope that had my (fake) signature. They had made it up. A bouncer was on our side at all times to act in case we would not pay and the bartender was very agressive. My friends and I decided to pay to avoid trouble and then the bartender acted all nice and gave us free shots (that we didn’t want). We took it and left as soon as we could. Throughout the night there also a girl trying to get us to buy her drinks but we realized after that she was part of the bar.

I WILL FILE A POLICE REPORT if the bar doesn’t contact me and reimburse me for the fees.

It seems like we are not the first ones to get scammed so an advice for potential customers… do not go to GOLDBAR unless you want to get scammed or even worse, physically hurt.

originalText.text: I agreed to have 300 go on my card towards the bar to get me in my 2 friends in despite being on the list. We probably each had 3-4 drinks I was gonna be fine with the rest going to gratuity or whatever because we were ready to leave. These guys charged me 480. Completely unacceptable and insane.

We probably each had 3-4 drinks I was gonna be fine with the rest going to gratuity or whatever because we were ready to leave. These guys charged me 480. Completely unacceptable and insane.

originalText.text: Ostentatious, gaudy, and down right tacky. This place is the epitome of insufferable taste! They NEED promoters to bring people is as the head count was so poor. As other users have mentioned, they were overcharged for drinks and so was I. i was charged 60$ for the equivalence of 2 drinks, and they both came out for $45 with tip included on the receipt i was given.
